III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
No technical assistance was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Formatting of treatment plans to include the treatment goals, action steps, and
progress in one location.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted four acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
SIR 2020C0128026 dated 11/15/2019 for which a CAP was approved on 11/15/2019
– It was verified through record reviews that the involved employee was terminated
and staff received refresher training related to privacy/HIPPA.
SIR 2020C0128004 dated 12/20/2019 for which a CAP was approved on 11/14/2019
– It was verified through record reviews that staff received refresher training in
privacy/HIPPA. It was verified during the on-site inspection that computer screens
were not visible and they remained locked when not in use.
Licensing Interim Inspection Report dated 11/26/2019 for which a CAP was approved
on 12/17/20
The Chief Administrator provided an assessment that identified issues related to staff
turnover and difficulties related to the current pandemic restriction. The assessment
4

provided a good overview of the efforts made by staff and administration to prevent
any disruption to services.
The only concern observed during the on-site inspection was that items were being
stored in the seclusion room of the Antonini home. The Chief Administrator
immediately addressed this with staff who removed the items. It was noted that this
room is rarely used by the program; however, it should remain clear of items in case it
is needed.
Staff and youth interviews were conducted and no issues or concerns were raised
outside of frustrations related to pandemic related restrictions. The staff have been
creative in keeping youth occupied despite outing restrictions.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, ISEP requirements and contract and policy. It is recommended
that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
